thread.title: Ex-child soldier from Sierra Leone freed in Minnesota
thread.title_full: Ex-child soldier from Sierra Leone freed in Minnesota | News24

author: news24.com
title: Ex-child soldier from Sierra Leone freed in Minnesota
text:
St Paul - A former child-soldier from Sierra Leone has been released after more than two years of immigration detention in Minnesota, his lawyers said on Friday.
US Magistrate Judge Leo Brisbois this week ruled Nelson Kargbo should go free, noting the US Supreme Court has previously held that the government can't indefinitely detain immigrants whom it has trouble deporting.
"I'm finally home," Kargbo said in a statement released by his attorneys. "I just want to walk outside with my kids and go play with them at the park. It feels so good to be free."
Immigration authorities detained Kargbo after he was arrested for misdemeanor domestic assault in 2013 and moved to deport him for several convictions on his record from between 2004 and 2009.
